contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox album | <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = One from the Modern | Type = [[Album]] | Artist = [[Ocean Colour Scene]] | Cover =One_from_the_Modern.jpg | Released =September 13, 1999 | Recorded = 1998–1998, Mosley Shoals Studio, [[Birmingham]] | Genre = [[Alternative rock]], [[blues rock]] | Length = 43:24 | Label = [[Island Records|Island]] | Producer = [[Brendan Lynch (music producer)|Brendan Lynch]] | Last album =''[[Marchin' Already]]''<br/>(1997) | This album ='''''One from the Modern'''''<br/>(1999) | Next album =''[[Mechanical Wonder]]''<br/>(2001) }} {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[Allmusic]] | rev1Score = {{Rating|4|5}} [{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r499388|pure_url=yes}} link] | rev2 = ''[[The Independent]]'' | rev2Score = (unfavourable) [http://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/cd-reviews-1117997.html link] }} '''''One from the Modern''''' is the fourth album by [[Ocean Colour Scene]]. The album made a departure from the two previous albums ''[[Moseley Shoals]]'' and ''[[Marchin' Already]]'', and is slower and sadder. It was panned by critics who accused it of being too commercial and labelled it "dad rock", although the end of [[Britpop]] may have also had something to do with it.{{Citation needed|date=March 2007}} The protest song "Profit in Peace" was the first single, with "So Low" and then a double release of "I Am the News"/"July". The song "Soul Driver" is dedicated to [[Paul Weller (singer)|Paul Weller]], who mentored the band. The album's cover photograph was taken in the Yew Garden at [[Packwood House]] near Solihull, England, a National Trust Property. ==Track listing== #"[[Profit in Peace]]" (4:14) #"[[So Low (Ocean Colour Scene song)|So Low]]" (3:54) #"I Am the News" (4:03) #"No-one at All" (3:34) #"Families" (3:11) #"Step by Step" (2:34) #"[[July (song)|July]]" (2:56) #"Jane She Got Excavated" (3:35) #"Emily Chambers" (2:40) #"Soul Driver" (3:44) #"The Waves" (6:08) #"I Won't Get Grazed" (2:51) {{OceanColourScene}} {{DEFAULTSORT:One From The Modern}} [[Category:Ocean Colour Scene albums]] [[Category:1999 albums]] [[Category:Island Records albums]]
